_header: Every day before you go to your bede
_description: George Ashby, Dicta et opiniones diversorum philosophorum — rhyme royal stanzas, each preceded by the Latin sentence which it translates

CULMm442.First Lines:
Euery day before ye go to youre bedeSerche wele al your guidyng by
                    remembrance…
CULMm442.Last Lines:
…In the world for he maketh no p[ ]mentOf his permisse but so
                    in neglige[nce]
CULMm442.Editions:
Bateson,  Mary,
                        ed.  
             George Ashby’s Poems.
